author: Special Correspondent
text:
Two persons sustained burns in an accidental fire which broke out when LPG was allegedly transferred from a domestic cylinder to a commercial cylinder at a tea shop in South Marret Street on Wednesday.

The police identified the injured as Saravanan (38), an employee of the tea shop and Venkatesh, the cylinder delivery man. They have been admitted to different hospitals with 30 per cent burns.

The police said that the incident occurred at around 3.15 p.m. at the tea shop on the busy South Marret street.

A domestic cylinder with its nozzle burnt in the fire was found on the premises when the police arrived at the spot. The South Gate police have registered a case for negligent conduct with respect to fire and endangering life against the tea shop owner, Sheik Taufiq Raghman, and the two injured. Raghman was arrested, the police said.
title: Two injured in accidental fire
